item.value: The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish, it can swim at 50 kilometres per hour. Olympic gold-medal swimmers could not escape even if they tried, they can only swim at 8 kph (5 mph) .
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The world's population grows by over 100 million each year.
Light travels slower through different substances such as glass, water and air.
The moon is just over one quarter the size of the earth.
Drinking too much water too quickly can lead to water intoxication which causes an imbalance of water in the brain
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
There are 206 bones in the adult human body and are 300 in children. As children age some bones fuse together.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
